title: Dev Patel brings his mum as his date to Academy Awards | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share And on Sunday he attended his first ever Oscars ceremony as a nominee and, in a lovely gesture, brought his Mum along all the way from Harrow in north London. Speaking from the red carpet, Dev told Baz Bamigboye for The Daily Mail: 'She encouraged me to act in the first place. She always told me to work hard and do my best and I've followed her instructions. She's worked hard all her life and I hope that I've followed her example.' Adding to the beautiful moment, he added: 'I'm so excited that my mum is my plus one.' Old-school glamour: Dev looked sharp as he flaunted his muscular frame in a suit - complete with smart bow tie - and wore his hair in his signature natural, tousled style on the red carpet Anita wore a traditional Indian sari in a stunning black and gold combination for her appearance at the most important movie industry night of the year. She hugged her son proudly as the pair walked the red carpet in front of a host of cameras. Her successful son Dev played it safe on the outfit front, but added a touch of his personal style by leaving his hair in its natural waves. Proud Mum: Anita, who lives in London, wore a traditional Indian sari in a stunning black and gold combination for her appearance at the most important movie industry night of the year The actor paired a perfectly fitted white jacket and shirt with a small bow tie, and completed the ensemble with a pair of smartly creased suit trousers. His patent leather shoes added yet another touch of old-school glamour and complemented his shiny bow tie. For his role as a Tasmanian surfer dude in Lion Dev had to bulk up for the first time. And it appears he has continued to make regular trips to the gym and chug down a few protein shakes since filming concluded, as the Slumdog Millionaire star showed off his honed physique in his fitted white jacket. Lion tells the tale of a five-year-old Indian boy who gets lost on the streets of Calcutta, thousands of kilometers from home. He survives many challenges before being adopted by a couple in Australia, but 25 years later he sets out to find his lost family. The film is Australian director Garth Davis' first feature movie and he had no idea when he set out on the project three years ago that it would be an Academy Award contender. But the film has already bagged a host of nominations at both the BAFTAs and the Academy Awards, with Nicole Kidman being nominated at the British awards and Oscars in the Best Supporting Actress category.
